reviews.review: Her class is enjoyable, but she noticeably like this one ass-sucker and gives him extra points while some people get points off for pronouncing her name wrong. Also she changes her mind so much and can be rude. She always gave me this look whenever I had a question about my quiz, she would be like "Yes you are here for the grades, AGAIN". I liked her at first and then by the end of the semester, I hated her.
Best teacher, class was relaxed and did not have a lot of work.

JOUR130 is a great class to take and as long as you put some effort in, you should get an A. Professor Stepno is really knowledgeable in her field of work and it helps a lot in trying to understand the topic presented in this class. You will definitely learn a lot of useful information too.
Really a great teacher, class with her was fun and enjoyable. would take her again if I needed another class in the area

She is amazing! Such a great speaker and person. We had a total of 6 presentations and one big final paper, but the topics were interesting. She will definitely help you improve you communication and presentation skills. You'll get an A if you do the work and participate. This class was a life-changing experience; I would take her again if I could!

She is an amazing professor. I often struggled with public speaking and honestly if you just put in the effort and truly show improvement she is most likely going to give a good grade on your presentations.

Professor Harris is a very kind and understanding professor. If you have the opportunity please take him as it's almost a guaranteed A. Just put in the work, the first few speaking assignments are annoying but weren't too bad. The final project seems intimidating but you can do it as a group and knock it out in less than a day. He is very forgiving and as long as you show some type of effort he will give you an A.

Professor Moore is well-suited for this class. She is so encouraging of her students and allows students to take their time to emotionally prepare before speaking which I found extremely helpful. She doesn't want students to fail or do bad in her class and you can clearly see that in her teaching!

He did not receive our syllabus for around a month because he was experiencing issues with Canvas. After Canvas had been restored, assignment due dates were a mess. Lecture was interesting for a while, then it began to feel like he was repeating the same topics. That said, you can tell he's passionate about speech and all students received an A in the course (all students received the same grade on each assignment, with maybe a 2 point difference). It wasn't horrible to take, but it did stress me out as I wasn't sure when certain assignments were due or my grade. Also, he tends to take while to respond to student messages (whether through email or text).
Every class was repetitive and boring. No one knew what was going on in the class. The only reason why I am not giving him a one-star review is that he gave good grades.

It was great to take a class on communication from someone who has real-world experience speaking in front of a TV camera! You can tell she wants the students to learn and succeed and will answer any questions and doubts you may have. Although I took it for a general education credit, I learned some information about public speaking and video recording which I will use in the future. The class isn;t difficult, mostly just reading from a textbook and then several projects.

You don't have to go to all of his classes. I went about once a week. Just follow the directions and you will get an A. He is a very nice guy, but sometimes his directions are unclear. He is very understanding and has done a lot in his life. Very hard to get an A+ but very easy to get an A.

You have to be good at public speaking in order to expect a good grade. She does not grade off of improvement but rather a rubric that applies from beginning to end. As long as you can follow her rubric then you'll be fine. If you want an easy COMM class, this one is not the one to take.

Amber is a great teacher, very helpful, and knows what she is talking about. The actual class is easy, and her feedback is super helpful. 6 presentations and a mid-term, you will learn a lot about public speaking, definitely worth it, especially since it's an easy A Oral Com gen ed. My only complaint is that the last month was fully virtual for us(she didn't explain why), and that limited the presentations. Be creative, she really grades easily if you are creative and put in the effort.

Easy A, but a bit disorganized (no Canvas until 2 weeks in, unclear due dates)

Lectures got a bit repetitive so we created a bingo chart for what would be stated in class:
"Secure the bag"
"I may not agree with Donald Trump politically, but he is a great influencer"
"I got BEEF"
"Climate Change is Real"
"You guys need to chillll"
"There *may* have been some lack of communication on my end"
"SECURE THE BAG"

Very helpful. Every class was the same. Probably cared less about the class than the students, didn't have an in-person class for over 5 weeks due to class cancellations or being switched to virtual lectures.  Every lecture was the same that we made a bingo chart for same exact quotes he would mention in class. I am pretty sure that all the assignment grades were randomly generated between a 95-98. Gave everyone good grades so it's all good.

She’s definitely a strong lecturer and public speaker. She’s also invested in students - she’ll schedule a one-on-one meeting with you if you aren’t doing as well in the class, to answer questions about her feedback and help you make a plan to improve.

Professor Moore is amazing!  She has real world experience in the topic and does a really good job at using it to help everyone succeed.  She is super kind and extremely invested in her students' success.  The course itself is super straight forward, she is not the type to make things difficult just to make things difficult.  If you just show up, listen to her feedback, and put in some effort you'll end up learning more about public speaking than anyone would in a gen-ed course.

I had this professor last year but never really got around to reviewing her. The fact that I often recommend her to friends reminded me that I should leave a positive review for selecting a professor for JOUR130. I absolutely hated public speaking and so naturally everything bad that could happen during a presentation happened. However, Professor Moore was understanding and lenient and even with my absolutely horrendous performance, I was still able to get a C. Thanks to her teaching style, I bounced back and ended the class with an A. I recommend taking her 100%!

He cancels class almost all the time and there is 6 assignments in the whole semester. The assignments are a 90-second videos due each week on a topic assigned. He will always give you an A no matter what you submit. While the class is easy and is a free A it is very disorganized and his canvas has messed up due dates and is confusing. He is also bad at responding to emails.

I loved Professor Moore! She gave really helpful feedback on the presentations and was always clear about her expectations for each assignment. She also wanted everyone to succeed and did her best to make you feel comfortable presenting in front of people. She was super kind and approachable, I would definitely recommend taking her for the FSOC gen ed.

Very easy class and I would highly recommend this professor. He cares about his students and genuinely wants to know more about them. The class is easy with a few assignments that aren't graded very hard. Attendance also isn't mandatory and he doesn't really mind when assignments aren't turned in on time. Fairly hard to get an A+ in the class but if you do all the work and put effort in an A will be very easy.

Easy class, cancels lectures quite often. Very chill and easy going guy, canvas was disorganized but I didn't mind it was an easy A. The final grade was a video submission talking about our personal life and school.

Prof. Gray is such an awesome guy.  This class is a free A and I think we met less than 10 times throughout the course of the semester.  The class/canvas is disorganized, but it doesn't matter because you'll only have like 5 assignments anyway.  He is super nice and an interesting person.  You can tell he is passionate about his work and life in general.

name: JOUR130
title: Self-Presentation in the Age of YouTube
description: Credit only granted for: COMM107, COMM200, ENES143, INAG110, JOUR130 or THET285. Additional information: May not count toward the Journalism major. Students, as they make use of evolving technologies, need to be able to present themselves effectively in front of any number of different audiences through any number of different outlets. Whether in an interview on radio, a guest presentation at a conference, in comments on a video blog, in commentary on TV, in the lead on a self-produced YouTube video, or as spokesperson in front of investors or management, professionals need strong oral communication skills. This class focuses on strengthening those skills through active individual and group presentations, as well as, through discussion of key techniques and group critique of presentation publicly available in the social media space on sites such as YouTube.
